page.title: 20DOWN THOMAS 2
page.content: (contd)in{1962-63.There are 5 farms {Paiges Farm,Court Barton,Staddon {Court,Manor Farm (the oldest,mentioned {in Domesday Book), and Princes Farm. The Silver Jubilee Hall was built in 1936, and an extension was added in 1979 so that C.of E. services could be held in Down Thomas. 20-30 people regularly attend services.{These {organizations meet at the SJH:Play- {school, Ladies Keep Fit Class,Childr- {en's Dancing Class, Down Thomas W.I., {D.T. Ladies Choir,& D.T. Dancing Acad- {emy.}4 people are employed at the rep- air garage. They all live outside the parish, and the garage is administered from Plymstock. There was a Methodist Chapel (built 1898- 1900). Services were held here until 1970, but in 1975 it was sold and converted.{There is a {pub called the Mussel Inn, and a shop {which is also the post office.
